Key.Original: Unfortunately, there are no suitable challenges for the selected items.
Key.English: Unfortunately, there are no suitable challenges for the selected items.

Key.Original: Operation will commence shortly. We are waiting for meta-challenges to finish.
Key.English: Operation will commence shortly. We are waiting for meta-challenges to finish.

Key.Original: We are now starting Operation.
Key.English: We are now starting Operation.

Key.Original: To ensure the safety of all our visitors, ARMEX is off-limits during Operation. Please leave immediately!
Key.English: To ensure the safety of all our visitors, ARMEX is off-limits during Operation. Please leave immediately!

Key.Original: has selected item
Key.English: has selected item

Key.Original: An item was randomly selected for
Key.English: An item was randomly selected for

Key.Original: The active challenge was aborted.
Key.English: The active challenge was aborted.

Key.Original: Operation is being halted. We are returning to ARMEX.
Key.English: Operation is being halted. We are returning to ARMEX.

Key.Original: The challenge was aborted.
Key.English: The challenge was aborted.

Key.Original: The enemy position is now under our control.
Key.English: The enemy position is now under our control.

Key.Original:
Enemy forces are holed up in a defended position. Your team is tasked with assaulting and securing the position.

You need to physically be at the target location, so just eliminating the defenders from afar is not enough. Once you've had control over the area for a little while, the challenge is deemed a success.

There may be several patrols between you and your target, so plan your assault well. Study the terrain and use its features to your advantage.
Key.English:
Enemy forces are holed up in a defended position. Your team is tasked with assaulting and securing the position.

You need to physically be at the target location, so just eliminating the defenders from afar is not enough. Once you've had control over the area for a little while, the challenge is deemed a success.

There may be several patrols between you and your target, so plan your assault well. Study the terrain and use its features to your advantage.

Key.Original: Move to the position and clear the enemy presence.
Key.English: Move to the position and clear the enemy presence.

Key.Original: You're all in the same type of vehicle, so compete to see who has the best driving skills and can cross the finish line first. You are not allowed to skip any of the checkpoints, so study the route on the map well.
Key.English: You're all in the same type of vehicle, so compete to see who has the best driving skills and can cross the finish line first. You are not allowed to skip any of the checkpoints, so study the route on the map well.

Key.Original: Beat the other players to the finish line.
Key.English: Beat the other players to the finish line.

Key.Original: Completion:
Key.English: Completion:

Key.Original: Convoy Ambush
Key.English: Convoy Ambush

Key.Original: Your team was able to take out all vehicles in the convoy.
Key.English: Your team was able to take out all vehicles in the convoy.

Key.Original: Unfortunately, you've let some vehicles get through.
Key.English: Unfortunately, you've let some vehicles get through.

Key.Original: All vehicles reached their intended destination.
Key.English: All vehicles reached their intended destination.

Key.Original:
An enemy ground convoy has been seen moving near our lines. Your team will be sent in to halt it. Take out the vehicle crews or disable the vehicles themselves.

You can also take an offensive stance and intercept the enemy elsewhere along the route. Be aware of enemy security vehicles and personnel traveling along with the convoy.
Key.English:
An enemy ground convoy has been seen moving near our lines. Your team will be sent in to halt it. Take out the vehicle crews or disable the vehicles themselves.

You can also take an offensive stance and intercept the enemy elsewhere along the route. Be aware of enemy security vehicles and personnel traveling along with the convoy.

Key.Original: Ambush the vehicle convoy.
Key.English: Ambush the vehicle convoy.

Key.Original: You're the winner!
Key.English: You're the winner!

Key.Original: You've lost!
Key.English: You've lost!

Key.Original:
Fight for your life and rack up as many points as you can by killing the other players. If you're using vehicles, you'll be the only crew member - so you need to man all stations by yourself.

Only the player with the most points wins, so there's no point in hiding or leaving the area.
Key.English:
Fight for your life and rack up as many points as you can by killing the other players. If you're using vehicles, you'll be the only crew member - so you need to man all stations by yourself.

Only the player with the most points wins, so there's no point in hiding or leaving the area.

Key.Original: Kill the other players 10 times before time runs out.
Key.English: Kill the other players 10 times before time runs out.

Key.Original: Kill the other players %1 times before time runs out.
Key.English: Kill the other players %1 times before time runs out.

Key.Original: You've fended off a formidable force.
Key.English: You've fended off a formidable force.

Key.Original: You've allowed your enemy to take control of the area and you were unable to quickly reclaim it.
Key.English: You've allowed your enemy to take control of the area and you were unable to quickly reclaim it.

Key.Original:
Several enemy units are advancing on a friendly position. Your team is to make sure the position does not get overrun.

Either take out all enemy forces or send them into retreat. Should the enemy take control of the position, quickly take it back.
Key.English:
Several enemy units are advancing on a friendly position. Your team is to make sure the position does not get overrun.

Either take out all enemy forces or send them into retreat. Should the enemy take control of the position, quickly take it back.

Key.Original: Defend the position against enemy attack.
Key.English: Defend the position against enemy attack.

Key.Original: You've used Fast-Travel.
Key.English: You've used Fast-Travel.

Key.Original: Item(s) used:
Key.English: Item(s) used:

Key.Original: Last Man Standing
Key.English: Last Man Standing

Key.Original: Be the last one to survive a battle to the death. If you're using vehicles, you'll be the only crew member, so you'll need to man all stations by yourself.
Key.English: Be the last one to survive a battle to the death. If you're using vehicles, you'll be the only crew member, so you'll need to man all stations by yourself.

Key.Original: Kill the other players before time runs out.
Key.English: Kill the other players before time runs out.

Key.Original: Too many players disconnected.
Key.English: Too many players disconnected.

Key.Original: Too many players used Fast-Travel.
Key.English: Too many players used Fast-Travel.

Key.Original: Points:
Key.English: Points:

Key.Original: You've survived the onslaught.
Key.English: You've survived the onslaught.

Key.Original: You did not survive.
Key.English: You did not survive.

Key.Original: Your team is continuously assaulted by waves of enemies. Survive as long as you can. Remember that you're not forced to stay in one location, so either move around or find a good defensive position.
Key.English: Your team is continuously assaulted by waves of enemies. Survive as long as you can. Remember that you're not forced to stay in one location, so either move around or find a good defensive position.

Key.Original: Survive the enemy attacks.
Key.English: Survive the enemy attacks.

Key.Original: Total:
Key.English: Total:

Key.Original: Triathlon
Key.English: Triathlon

Key.Original: Checkpoint #%1 (Vehicle Change)
Key.English: Checkpoint #%1 (Vehicle Change)

Key.Original: During this race you will be using three different vehicles. Swap to a new vehicle at each checkpoint, where the vehicles are parked. You're not allowed to skip any of the checkpoints, so study the route on the map well.
Key.English: During this race you will be using three different vehicles. Swap to a new vehicle at each checkpoint, where the vehicles are parked. You're not allowed to skip any of the checkpoints, so study the route on the map well.

Key.Original: Challenge starting in %1
Key.English: Challenge starting in %1

Key.Original: Fast-Traveling
Key.English: Fast-Traveling

Key.Original: Waiting for ARMEX to open its gates
Key.English: Waiting for ARMEX to open its gates

Key.Original: Respawning in %1
Key.English: Respawning in %1

Key.Original: Feel free to use any item you encounter at ARMEX. Try not to harm the other visitors in your experimentation.
Key.English: Feel free to use any item you encounter at ARMEX. Try not to harm the other visitors in your experimentation.

Key.Original: Most wheeled vehicles drive faster on roads.
Key.English: Most wheeled vehicles drive faster on roads.

Key.Original: To avoid stalling and crashing, keep an eye on your airplane's speed.
Key.English: To avoid stalling and crashing, keep an eye on your airplane's speed.

Key.Original: Machineguns require you to stabilize your firing position by going prone.
Key.English: Machineguns require you to stabilize your firing position by going prone.

Key.Original: Many tracked vehicles (and other armored vehicles) allow you to open the hatches of crew positions and turn out. You are less well protected, but your environmental awareness is increased.
Key.English: Many tracked vehicles (and other armored vehicles) allow you to open the hatches of crew positions and turn out. You are less well protected, but your environmental awareness is increased.

Key.Original: Tracked vehicles are maneuverable on any surface and allow for quick cross-country transport. They can also turn on the spot.
Key.English: Tracked vehicles are maneuverable on any surface and allow for quick cross-country transport. They can also turn on the spot.

Key.Original: Some tracked vehicles are amphibious, enabling movement across both land and water. However, the maximum speed in water is usually severely limited.
Key.English: Some tracked vehicles are amphibious, enabling movement across both land and water. However, the maximum speed in water is usually severely limited.

Key.Original: Since tracked vehicles are usually big and powerful, they also tend to be loud. Employ them carefully, as your enemy will usually hear you coming from afar.
Key.English: Since tracked vehicles are usually big and powerful, they also tend to be loud. Employ them carefully, as your enemy will usually hear you coming from afar.

Key.Original: Always be on the lookout for anti-armor weaponry, such as man-portable launchers. Their armor-penetrating munitions can quickly disable or destroy your vehicle.
Key.English: Always be on the lookout for anti-armor weaponry, such as man-portable launchers. Their armor-penetrating munitions can quickly disable or destroy your vehicle.

Key.Original: It is usually wise to steer clear of urban areas in tracked vehicles. There are many hiding places for IEDs, anti-armor infantry and it's much harder to manoeuvre.
Key.English: It is usually wise to steer clear of urban areas in tracked vehicles. There are many hiding places for IEDs, anti-armor infantry and it's much harder to manoeuvre.

Key.Original: Heavy tracked vehicles can be used to breach compounds and structures by ramming into walls and fences, thus clearing the way for infantry.
Key.English: Heavy tracked vehicles can be used to breach compounds and structures by ramming into walls and fences, thus clearing the way for infantry.

Key.Original: You can Fast-Travel to another part of ARMEX at the information kiosks.
Key.English: You can Fast-Travel to another part of ARMEX at the information kiosks.

Key.Original: In combined operations, be mindful of infantry operating around your vehicle. You lack environmental awareness and can easily miss people in your vicinity, particularly when 'turned in'.
Key.English: In combined operations, be mindful of infantry operating around your vehicle. You lack environmental awareness and can easily miss people in your vicinity, particularly when 'turned in'.

Key.Original: Many tracked vehicles carry sabot and high-explosive ammunition. Sabot is armor-piercing and good to use against other armored vehicles. High-explosive rounds are very effective against soft targets, such as groups of infantry.
Key.English: Many tracked vehicles carry sabot and high-explosive ammunition. Sabot is armor-piercing and good to use against other armored vehicles. High-explosive rounds are very effective against soft targets, such as groups of infantry.

Key.Original: Advanced tracked vehicles use a ballistic computer to make the gunner's life a bit easier. After locking onto a target, the weapon automatically zeroes and it tracks the target.
Key.English: Advanced tracked vehicles use a ballistic computer to make the gunner's life a bit easier. After locking onto a target, the weapon automatically zeroes and it tracks the target.

Key.Original: As a tracked vehicle commander, you'll often have access to countermeasures. Deploy smoke screens to obscure your enemy's vision.
Key.English: As a tracked vehicle commander, you'll often have access to countermeasures. Deploy smoke screens to obscure your enemy's vision.

Key.Original: Learn about the Multiplayer Armory by checking out the ARMEX brochure available from the information kiosks, or by checking your diary notes.
Key.English: Learn about the Multiplayer Armory by checking out the ARMEX brochure available from the information kiosks, or by checking your diary notes.

Key.Original: Curious about the actual player rankings and who selected which item? Access the rankings from the Quick Menu.
Key.English: Curious about the actual player rankings and who selected which item? Access the rankings from the Quick Menu.

Key.Original: If you don't want to see these hints and other forms of assistance, you can disable them from the Quick Menu. You can always enable the system again later.
Key.English: If you don't want to see these hints and other forms of assistance, you can disable them from the Quick Menu. You can always enable the system again later.

Key.Original: A wheeled vehicle's obvious weak points are its tyres. One or more flat tyres seriously affects your steering. Only engineers can change tyres in the field.
Key.English: A wheeled vehicle's obvious weak points are its tyres. One or more flat tyres seriously affects your steering. Only engineers can change tyres in the field.

Key.Original: Actively monitor your fuel level, since you don't want to be stuck in a combat zone without fuel. Damage can cause fuel leaks which rapidly drain your tanks. You can refuel at fuel trucks or fuel tanks.
Key.English: Actively monitor your fuel level, since you don't want to be stuck in a combat zone without fuel. Damage can cause fuel leaks which rapidly drain your tanks. You can refuel at fuel trucks or fuel tanks.

Key.Original: Individual components in your vehicle, such as engines, tracks, rotors and turrets, can be damaged or destroyed. Component status is visualized in your HUD, showing green for no damage and moving to red for critical damage.
Key.English: Individual components in your vehicle, such as engines, tracks, rotors and turrets, can be damaged or destroyed. Component status is visualized in your HUD, showing green for no damage and moving to red for critical damage.

Key.Original: Use the "Quick Menu" in the Action Menu to access voting, quick item selection and other options.
Key.English: Use the "Quick Menu" in the Action Menu to access voting, quick item selection and other options.

Key.Original: In vehicles with dedicated gunners, only they can fire weapons. Switch to manual fire to take over control of the primary weapon system as a driver or pilot.
Key.English: In vehicles with dedicated gunners, only they can fire weapons. Switch to manual fire to take over control of the primary weapon system as a driver or pilot.

Key.Original: When your vehicle is away from repair trucks or repair stations, only engineers are able to perform maintenance. However, note that they can only repair up to 60% of a vehicle's undamaged state.
Key.English: When your vehicle is away from repair trucks or repair stations, only engineers are able to perform maintenance. However, note that they can only repair up to 60% of a vehicle's undamaged state.

Key.Original: Many modern vehicles come equipped with a radar. It shows a top-down view of your surroundings with square icons representing ground vehicles and triangles indicating aircraft. Red icons are enemy targets, whereas green icons are friendly.
Key.English: Many modern vehicles come equipped with a radar. It shows a top-down view of your surroundings with square icons representing ground vehicles and triangles indicating aircraft. Red icons are enemy targets, whereas green icons are friendly.

Key.Original: Thermal Imagery helps vehicle crews to spot threats both during the day and at night. Any heat source is clearly distinguishable, so vehicle engines, weapon muzzles and even humans stand out. You're even able to look through smoke.
Key.English: Thermal Imagery helps vehicle crews to spot threats both during the day and at night. Any heat source is clearly distinguishable, so vehicle engines, weapon muzzles and even humans stand out. You're even able to look through smoke.

Key.Original: Keep clear of destroyed vehicles. As fire and heat reach fuel and ammunition, dangerous secondary explosions may be triggered.
Key.English: Keep clear of destroyed vehicles. As fire and heat reach fuel and ammunition, dangerous secondary explosions may be triggered.

Key.Original: While inside a vehicle you can switch to other positions which are accessible from the compartment you are currently in. To move to inaccessible positions, you'll first have to get out.
Key.English: While inside a vehicle you can switch to other positions which are accessible from the compartment you are currently in. To move to inaccessible positions, you'll first have to get out.

Key.Original: When vehicle weapons support various types of ammunition, you can load different types from the Action Menu.
Key.English: When vehicle weapons support various types of ammunition, you can load different types from the Action Menu.

Key.Original: To compensate for bullets dropping as they fly, some weapon sights can be zeroed to specific ranges.
Key.English: To compensate for bullets dropping as they fly, some weapon sights can be zeroed to specific ranges.

Key.Original: A lot of weapons have several types of sights and optics. Some are better for close quarters combat, while others can be zoomed for targets at long ranges. Many optics also support night vision modes.
Key.English: A lot of weapons have several types of sights and optics. Some are better for close quarters combat, while others can be zoomed for targets at long ranges. Many optics also support night vision modes.

Key.Original: When you require better accuracy, try holding your breath to steady your aim.
Key.English: When you require better accuracy, try holding your breath to steady your aim.

Key.Original: Once you are ready to start doing challenges on Operation, vote to do so in the Quick Menu.
Key.English: Once you are ready to start doing challenges on Operation, vote to do so in the Quick Menu.

Key.Original: Try not to move too much while you fire your weapon. Firing from a fixed position will dramatically improve your aim.
Key.English: Try not to move too much while you fire your weapon. Firing from a fixed position will dramatically improve your aim.

Key.Original: Reloading weapons is best done from cover, since you are unable to return fire while you reload.
Key.English: Reloading weapons is best done from cover, since you are unable to return fire while you reload.

Key.Original: Always lead (aim in advance of) moving targets to compensate for its movement and your munition's travel time..
Key.English: Always lead (aim in advance of) moving targets to compensate for its movement and your munition's travel time.

Key.Original: Weapons will often have several fire modes to select from, such as semi-automatic, burst and full-automatic.
Key.English: Weapons will often have several fire modes to select from, such as semi-automatic, burst and full-automatic.

Key.Original: Since static weapons cannot move, sometimes you will be forced to get out and fend off enemy flank or rear attacks.
Key.English: Since static weapons cannot move, sometimes you will be forced to get out and fend off enemy flank or rear attacks.

Key.Original: Indirect fire weapons can be more easily targeted using the Artillery Computer available in the Action Menu.
Key.English: Indirect fire weapons can be more easily targeted using the Artillery Computer available in the Action Menu.

Key.Original: Their high rate of fire makes machine guns ideal candidates for suppressing groups of infantry.
Key.English: Their high rate of fire makes machine guns ideal candidates for suppressing groups of infantry.

Key.Original: Sidearms are primarily back-up and personal defense weapons. They are meant to be used on short-range targets.
Key.English: Sidearms are primarily back-up and personal defense weapons. They are meant to be used on short-range targets.

Key.Original: Launchers and their projectiles are heavy and bulky, so you are usually not able to carry a lot of ammunition for them. Only fire when you have a good lock on your target.
Key.English: Launchers and their projectiles are heavy and bulky, so you are usually not able to carry a lot of ammunition for them. Only fire when you have a good lock on your target.

Key.Original: It may take a while before a launcher acquires a full lock onto a target. Wait for the audio cues that indicate a successful lock before firing.
Key.English: It may take a while before a launcher acquires a full lock onto a target. Wait for the audio cues that indicate a successful lock before firing.

Key.Original: The items you select at ARMEX are used to dynamically create your challenges on Operation.
Key.English: The items you select at ARMEX are used to dynamically create your challenges on Operation.

Key.Original: In helicopters, you can enable auto-hovering, which will automatically stabilize the aircraft and make it hover in one spot.
Key.English: In helicopters, you can enable auto-hovering, which will automatically stabilize the aircraft and make it hover in one spot.

Key.Original: Flying in a helicopter makes you an excellent target for a wide range of anti-air weapons. Try to fly fast and low and to mask your aircraft using terrain features.
Key.English: Flying in a helicopter makes you an excellent target for a wide range of anti-air weapons. Try to fly fast and low and to mask your aircraft using terrain features.

Key.Original: When you lose your tail rotor, your helicopter will become very hard to fly and it may spin out of control. Find a safe area to land as quickly as you can.
Key.English: When you lose your tail rotor, your helicopter will become very hard to fly and it may spin out of control. Find a safe area to land as quickly as you can.

Key.Original: Advanced helicopters can have so-called Radar Warning Receivers, which will alert you to an enemy weapons locks, thus allowing you to respond appropriately.
Key.English: Advanced helicopters can have so-called Radar Warning Receivers, which will alert you to an enemy weapons locks, thus allowing you to respond appropriately.

Key.Original: Losing your engine means you'll have to use auto-rotation in order to land safely. Immediately descend to keep your rotors spinning, but limit forward speed. At the last moment flare up the aircraft and increase thrust. Timing this correctly is essential.
Key.English: Losing your engine means you'll have to use auto-rotation in order to land safely. Immediately descend to keep your rotors spinning, but limit forward speed. At the last moment flare up the aircraft and increase thrust. Timing this correctly is essential.

Key.Original: A good Landing Zone is clear of objects which may damage your helicopter. Preferably, you should land on level terrain.
Key.English: A good Landing Zone is clear of objects which may damage your helicopter. Preferably, you should land on level terrain.

Key.Original: Aircraft may have been equipped with countermeasures, such as flares and chaff, to confuse incoming missiles.
Key.English: Aircraft may have been equipped with countermeasures, such as flares and chaff, to confuse incoming missiles.

Key.Original: A number of airplanes are capable of Vertical Take-Off and Landing (VTOL), either fully or they can take off from short runways and land vertically. These airplanes can transition to and from forward flight in mid-air.
Key.English: A number of airplanes are capable of Vertical Take-Off and Landing (VTOL), either fully or they can take off from short runways and land vertically. These airplanes can transition to and from forward flight in mid-air.

Key.Original: Enabling the autopilot in airplanes will cause them to land on the nearest runway.
Key.English: Enabling the autopilot in airplanes will cause them to land on the nearest runway.

Key.Original: When you feel there is nothing you can do to avert crashing your airplane, try to move away from locations which would cause a lot of casualties and eject.
Key.English: When you feel there is nothing you can do to avert crashing your airplane, try to move away from locations which would cause a lot of casualties and eject.

Key.Original: Point at the item information signs to read descriptions and view statistics.
Key.English: Point at the item information signs to read descriptions and view statistics.

Key.Original: Various airplanes carry laser-guided munitions. Cooperate with ground forces who can laser-designate targets, allowing you to perform precision strikes.
Key.English: Various airplanes carry laser-guided munitions. Cooperate with ground forces who can laser-designate targets, allowing you to perform precision strikes.

Key.Original: The use of an airplane's flaps can provide you improved lift at low speeds.
Key.English: The use of an airplane's flaps can provide you improved lift at low speeds.

Key.Original: Infra-Red strobes can only be seen using night vision equipment and allow gunners to precisely target marked locations.
Key.English: Infra-Red strobes can only be seen using night vision equipment and allow gunners to precisely target marked locations.

Key.Original: Throwable explosives are good for engaging targets behind cover, or those which are grouped together.
Key.English: Throwable explosives are good for engaging targets behind cover, or those which are grouped together.

Key.Original: Explosives placed on the ground can often be deactivated and picked back up.
Key.English: Explosives placed on the ground can often be deactivated and picked back up.

Key.Original: There is a maximum range from which you can detonate explosives using a trigger.
Key.English: There is a maximum range from which you can detonate explosives using a trigger.

Key.Original: The longer you wait to release a throw, the more power you use and thus the further you throw.
Key.English: The longer you wait to release a throw, the more power you use and thus the further you throw.

Key.Original: At longer ranges, it is often wise to use a semi-automatic fire mode. This way, you can recover from the rifle's recoil effect before your next shot.
Key.English: At longer ranges, it is often wise to use a semi-automatic fire mode. This way, you can recover from the rifle's recoil effect before your next shot.

Key.Original: Some rifles have laser pointer attachments that are only visible using night vision equipment. They can be used to aim and to point out things on the battlefield to forces equipped with night vision equipment.
Key.English: Some rifles have laser pointer attachments that are only visible using night vision equipment. They can be used to aim and to point out things on the battlefield to forces equipped with night vision equipment.

Key.Original: Flashlights mounted to rifles can obviously be used to navigate dark environments, but also to temporarily blind enemies.
Key.English: Flashlights mounted to rifles can obviously be used to navigate dark environments, but also to temporarily blind enemies.

Key.Original: The item you selected is not always what you will use on Operation. In some challenges the item is used by your enemies, while in others it is not used at all.
Key.English: The item you selected is not always what you will use on Operation. In some challenges the item is used by your enemies, while in others it is not used at all.

Key.Original: Coming under fire in a vehicle, it may be wise to do a combat dismount and take cover behind the vehicle. This way you can return fire more effectively. Not all vehicles provide good cover however, so also use your surroundings.
Key.English: Coming under fire in a vehicle, it may be wise to do a combat dismount and take cover behind the vehicle. This way you can return fire more effectively. Not all vehicles provide good cover however, so also use your surroundings.

Key.Original: Always keep an eye on your remaining weapon ammunition. If you are running low and there is no ammunition for your current weapon, consider using the weapon of a fallen soldier.
Key.English: Always keep an eye on your remaining weapon ammunition. If you are running low and there is no ammunition for your current weapon, consider using the weapon of a fallen soldier.

Key.Original: Challenges
Key.English: Challenges

Key.Original: This diary section will list descriptions of all challenges as they become activated.
Key.English: This diary section will list descriptions of all challenges as they become activated.

Key.Original: Introduction
Key.English: Introduction

Key.Original:
You can vote on a number of things, such as going on Operation, returning to ARMEX, or starting a specific challenge. Once a majority vote is reached, the corresponding action is performed.

Voting is accessed through the Quick Menu, which, in turn, is opened in the Action Menu (or Communications Menu from inside vehicles).
Key.English:
You can vote on a number of things, such as going on Operation, returning to ARMEX, or starting a specific challenge. Once a majority vote is reached, the corresponding action is performed.

Voting is accessed through the Quick Menu, which, in turn, is opened in the Action Menu (or Communications Menu from inside vehicles).

Key.Original:
Operation is a series of challenges outside of ARMEX. These challenges are generated dynamically, based upon the items selected by all players.

Challenges can be different each time and, depending on the type of challenge, not all items will be used. Sometimes a challenge will give everyone the same randomly selected item. To see which items are used by a challenge, check its task description.

In case you are unsure what you are expected to do, refer to your diary and look over your tasks and the special %1 section.
Key.English:
Operation is a series of challenges outside of ARMEX. These challenges are generated dynamically, based upon the items selected by all players.

Challenges can be different each time and, depending on the type of challenge, not all items will be used. Sometimes a challenge will give everyone the same randomly selected item. To see which items are used by a challenge, check its task description.

In case you are unsure what you are expected to do, refer to your diary and look over your tasks and the special %1 section.

Key.Original:
Meta-challenges are simple, dynamic challenges which are adjusted to the item you are using. Completing them is optional, but it will earn you and / or the team points. Note, most meta-challenges will not allow the use of Fast-Travel.

Please refer to section %1 in your diary for more information on specific meta-challenges.
Key.English:
Meta-challenges are simple, dynamic challenges which are adjusted to the item you are using. Completing them is optional, but it will earn you and / or the team points. Note, most meta-challenges will not allow the use of Fast-Travel.

Please refer to section %1 in your diary for more information on specific meta-challenges.

Key.Original:
ARMEX (ARMory EXhibition) is a military tradeshow showcasing all types of in-game items. Each time you visit ARMEX, you may find different items.

At ARMEX, you are free to do what you like. Each item has an information sign next to it, which displays a text description and statistics of that item. You are also free to try out any item and complete meta-challenges with it.
Key.English:
ARMEX (ARMory EXhibition) is a military tradeshow showcasing all types of in-game items. Each time you visit ARMEX, you may find different items.

At ARMEX, you are free to do what you like. Each item has an information sign next to it, which displays a text description and statistics of that item. You are also free to try out any item and complete meta-challenges with it.

Key.Original:
Welcome to the Multiplayer Armory and ARMEX!

This dynamic and interactive game mode offers you the chance to explore all of the game's content together. You can simply play around with anything you find at ARMEX or go complete dynamic challenges with or against other players.

Have fun!
Key.English:
Welcome to the Multiplayer Armory and ARMEX!

This dynamic and interactive game mode offers you the chance to explore all of the game's content together. You can simply play around with anything you find at ARMEX or go complete dynamic challenges with or against other players.

Have fun!

Key.Original: Voting
Key.English: Voting

Key.Original: Operation
Key.English: Operation

Key.Original: Meta-Challenges
Key.English: Meta-Challenges

Key.Original: This diary section will list descriptions of all %1 as they become activated.
Key.English: This diary section will list descriptions of all %1 as they become activated.

Key.Original: meta-challenges
Key.English: meta-challenges

Key.Original: Airtime
Key.English: Airtime

Key.Original: Current Airtime:
Key.English: Current Airtime:

Key.Original: You've racked up sufficient airtime.
Key.English: You've racked up sufficient airtime.

Key.Original: There are plenty of jumps at ARMEX, such as ramps and mounts, which you can use to get your vehicle temporarily airborne.
Key.English: There are plenty of jumps at ARMEX, such as ramps and mounts, which you can use to get your vehicle temporarily airborne.

Key.Original: Get at least %1 seconds of airtime.
Key.English: Get at least %1 seconds of airtime.

Key.Original: All Aboard
Key.English: All Aboard

Key.Original: You've boarded the vehicle.
Key.English: You've boarded the vehicle.

Key.Original: The vehicle was disabled.
Key.English: The vehicle was disabled.

Key.Original: Using the same vehicle together can be very beneficial for your team. You can man all important crew positions and transport others.
Key.English: Using the same vehicle together can be very beneficial for your team. You can man all important crew positions and transport others.

Key.Original: Get into the %1.
Key.English: Get into the %1.

Key.Original: Wait for the others to board the vehicle.
Key.English: Wait for the others to board the vehicle.

Key.Original: You managed to stay below the set ceiling.
Key.English: You managed to stay below the set ceiling.

Key.Original: Flying low and fast tests your agility, but radars and anti-aircraft weapons will have more difficulty tracking you.
Key.English: Flying low and fast tests your agility, but radars and anti-aircraft weapons will have more difficulty tracking you.

Key.Original: Start flying below %1 meters.
Key.English: Start flying below %1 meters.

Key.Original: Keep flying below %1 meters.
Key.English: Keep flying below %1 meters.

Key.Original: Meta-Challenge completed.
Key.English: Meta-Challenge completed.

Key.Original: Meta-Challenge failed.
Key.English: Meta-Challenge failed.

Key.Original: Gather
Key.English: Gather

Key.Original: You've met up with the others on time.
Key.English: You've met up with the others on time.

Key.Original: The %1 contains many different areas. This challenge brings you all together at one of them. Exploring %1 together can be a lot of fun!
Key.English: The %1 contains many different areas. This challenge brings you all together at one of them. Exploring %1 together can be a lot of fun!

Key.Original: Meet the other players at area: %1.
Key.English: Meet the other players at area: %1.

Key.Original: Meet the other players at area: <marker name='BIS_MPA_marker_area_%2'>%1</marker>.
Key.English: Meet the other players at area: <marker name='BIS_MPA_marker_area_%2'>%1</marker>.

Key.Original: Wait for the others to arrive.
Key.English: Wait for the others to arrive.

Key.Original: You got away in time.
Key.English: You got away in time.

Key.Original: Being able to retreat from a position quickly and efficiently is a vital combat skill. Always scan your surroundings for escape routes, bearing in mind terrain, obstacles and enemies.
Key.English: Being able to retreat from a position quickly and efficiently is a vital combat skill. Always scan your surroundings for escape routes, bearing in mind terrain, obstacles and enemies.

Key.Original: Get %1 meters away from your position.
Key.English: Get %1 meters away from your position.

Key.Original: You managed to reach the desired speed.
Key.English: You managed to reach the desired speed.

Key.Original: It's a good idea to know how fast your vehicle can get you out of a dangerous situation.
Key.English: It's a good idea to know how fast your vehicle can get you out of a dangerous situation.

Key.Original: Reach %1 kmph.
Key.English: Reach %1 kmph.

Key.Original: You landed your aircraft.
Key.English: You landed your aircraft.

Key.Original: The inevitable result of flying an aircraft is having to land it again at some point. Sometimes you'll have to land in an emergency or a combat zone, so it's wise to practise landing on many different types of location.
Key.English: The inevitable result of flying an aircraft is having to land it again at some point. Sometimes you'll have to land in an emergency or a combat zone, so it's wise to practise landing on many different types of location.

Key.Original: Land your aircraft and stop it completely.
Key.English: Land your aircraft and stop it completely.

Key.Original: You managed to maintain the speed.
Key.English: You managed to maintain the speed.

Key.Original: There are many situations where you don't want to slow down your vehicle, such as while driving a convoy through an enemy area. A moving target is a harder target.
Key.English: There are many situations where you don't want to slow down your vehicle, such as while driving a convoy through an enemy area. A moving target is a harder target.

Key.Original: Maintain %1 kmph.
Key.English: Maintain %1 kmph.

Key.Original: Night
Key.English: Night

Key.Original: You've completed the challenge at night.
Key.English: You've completed the challenge at night.

Key.Original: You did not complete the challenge.
Key.English: You did not complete the challenge.

Key.Original: Any task which may be assigned to you can become harder to complete at night. This is a bonus for completing a challenge in those limiting conditions.
Key.English: Any task which may be assigned to you can become harder to complete at night. This is a bonus for completing a challenge in those limiting conditions.

Key.Original: Complete your current challenge at night.
Key.English: Complete your current challenge at night.

Key.Original: You've performed a one-eighty.
Key.English: You've performed a one-eighty.

Key.Original: Since most vehicles go faster moving forward, sometimes executing a 180 degree turn is a smart move.
Key.English: Since most vehicles go faster moving forward, sometimes executing a 180 degree turn is a smart move.

Key.Original: Completely turn your vehicle around.
Key.English: Completely turn your vehicle around.

Key.Original: Protect Player
Key.English: Protect Player

Key.Original: You managed to successfully protect your assigned player.
Key.English: You managed to successfully protect your assigned player.

Key.Original: The player assigned to you was injured and / or killed too often.
Key.English: The player assigned to you was injured and / or killed too often.

Key.Original: Teamwork is very important and rewarding. When you stay with team members you can protect them from dangers they may have missed.
Key.English: Teamwork is very important and rewarding. When you stay with team members you can protect them from dangers they may have missed.

Key.Original: Protect your assigned player (%1).
Key.English: Protect your assigned player (%1).

Key.Original: Race to Position
Key.English: Race to Position

Key.Original: You finished first.
Key.English: You finished first.

Key.Original: You've lost the race.
Key.English: You've lost the race.

Key.Original: Getting to a position as quickly as possible can be important in many situations, such as when having to extract injured personnel or defend a friendly position.
Key.English: Getting to a position as quickly as possible can be important in many situations, such as when having to extract injured personnel or defend a friendly position.

Key.Original: Race the other players to the marked position.
Key.English: Race the other players to the marked position.

Key.Original: Rush
Key.English: Rush

Key.Original: Your completion time for the challenge was not fast enough.
Key.English: Your completion time for the challenge was not fast enough.

Key.Original: You've completed the challenge quickly.
Key.English: You've completed the challenge quickly.

Key.Original: Sometimes it is beneficial to complete a challenge quickly and this is a bonus for doing so.
Key.English: Sometimes it is beneficial to complete a challenge quickly and this is a bonus for doing so.

Key.Original: Complete your current challenge quickly.
Key.English: Complete your current challenge quickly.

Key.Original: You've reached the desired altitude.
Key.English: You've reached the desired altitude.

Key.Original: Getting your aircraft to fly high is not as easy as it seems. You have to be wary of stalling.
Key.English: Getting your aircraft to fly high is not as easy as it seems. You have to be wary of stalling.

Key.Original: Ascend to %1 meters.
Key.English: Ascend to %1 meters.

Key.Original: You've fully stopped your vehicle.
Key.English: You've fully stopped your vehicle.

Key.Original: Sometimes you need to suddenly halt your vehicle's movement. Finding ways to do so quickly may save your life.
Key.English: Sometimes you need to suddenly halt your vehicle's movement. Finding ways to do so quickly may save your life.

Key.Original: Stop your vehicle completely.
Key.English: Stop your vehicle completely.

Key.Original: Your Meta-Challenge(s):
Key.English: Your Meta-Challenge(s):

Key.English: Concrete Wall

Key.English: Direction

Key.English: Entrance Gate (ARMEX)

Key.English: Flag (ARMEX)

Key.English: Info Board

Key.English: Laptop

Key.English: Loudspeakers

Key.English: Plastic Pole

Key.English: Red Light

Key.English: Point limit applied to:

Key.English: 2 hours

Key.English: 2.5 hours

Key.English: 30 min.

Key.English: 1 hour

Key.Original: 1.5 hours
Key.English: 1.5 hours

Key.Original:
Welcome to ARMEX!

Since you are quite new to ARMEX, you can become familiar with it by following a short series of tasks (available in your diary).
Key.English:
Welcome to ARMEX!

Since you are quite new to ARMEX, you can become familiar with it by following a short series of tasks (available in your diary).

Key.Original:
Now start using this item or any other and do with it what you like.

You have familiarized yourself with the basics of the Multiplayer Armory. Have fun exploring ARMEX and going on Operation!
Key.English:
Now start using this item or any other and do with it what you like.

You have familiarized yourself with the basics of the Multiplayer Armory. Have fun exploring ARMEX and going on Operation!

Key.Original: Visit any information kiosk and view the info brochure. Take as much time as you need to read through the available information.
Key.English: Visit any information kiosk and view the info brochure. Take as much time as you need to read through the available information.

Key.Original: Go to the marked item and look at its information sign. If you like, you can use the vehicles parked near the entrance to get there.
Key.English: Go to the marked item and look at its information sign. If you like, you can use the vehicles parked near the entrance to get there.

Key.Original: Use the Action Menu to select the item in front of you. In the Operation phase, this item will be used whenever possible.
Key.English: Use the Action Menu to select the item in front of you. In the Operation phase, this item will be used whenever possible.

Key.Original: Visit Information Kiosk
Key.English: Visit Information Kiosk

Key.Original: View Item
Key.English: View Item

Key.Original: Select Item
Key.English: Select Item

Key.Original: Use Fast-Travel
Key.English: Use Fast-Travel

Key.Original: Quick Menu
Key.English: Quick Menu

Key.Original: Select:
Key.English: Select:

Key.Original: View Info Brochure
Key.English: View Info Brochure

Key.Original: ARMEX Brochure
Key.English: ARMEX Brochure

Key.Original:
What is ARMEX?

ARMEX is the military expo you are currently visiting. It has a selection of the game's equipment on display.

You can view information on each item and try them out immediately. Find and explore the special testing grounds and complete meta-challenges for points.
Key.English:
What is ARMEX?

ARMEX is the military expo you are currently visiting. It has a selection of the game's equipment on display.

You can view information on each item and try them out immediately. Find and explore the special testing grounds and complete meta-challenges for points.

Key.Original:
Meta-Challenges?

Meta-challenges are little challenges you can complete for points, but don't have to. Some meta-challenges are completed together and some are individual. Depending on the session parameters, either your individual points or the points gathered by all players determine the session outcome.

Many meta-challenges are based on the items you use, so try to use some and see what happens.
Key.English:
Meta-Challenges?

Meta-challenges are little challenges you can complete for points, but don't have to. Some meta-challenges are completed together and some are individual. Depending on the session parameters, either your individual points or the points gathered by all players determine the session outcome.

Many meta-challenges are based on the items you use, so try to use some and see what happens.

Key.Original:
Why select items?

Selecting items determines which items will be used for you in the next major phase of the Multiplayer Armory: Operation. Please note, some challenges will not use all items selected by all players; rather, a selection is used, based on the type of challenge.

You can manually select items at their physical location at ARMEX or by quick-selecting in the Quick Menu. This is not possible during Operation, so you'll have to return to ARMEX to make changes. Check the rankings to find out which item you and the other players have selected at any time.
Key.English:
Why select items?

Selecting items determines which items will be used for you in the next major phase of the Multiplayer Armory: Operation. Please note, some challenges will not use all items selected by all players; rather, a selection is used, based on the type of challenge.

You can manually select items at their physical location at ARMEX or by quick-selecting in the Quick Menu. This is not possible during Operation, so you'll have to return to ARMEX to make changes. Check the rankings to find out which item you and the other players have selected at any time.

Key.Original:
What is Operation?

Operation is a series of bigger challenges to complete. The contents and types of challenges are based on the items selected by all participating players.

Operation is started when the majority of players at ARMEX vote to do so. Likewise, you can return to ARMEX by voting for it.
Key.English:
What is Operation?

Operation is a series of bigger challenges to complete. The contents and types of challenges are based on the items selected by all participating players.

Operation is started when the majority of players at ARMEX vote to do so. Likewise, you can return to ARMEX by voting for it.

Key.Original:
Quick Menu?

The Quick Menu is where you can vote, open the quick-select interface and do several other things.

The Quick Menu can be accessed from the Action Menu, or the Communications Menu (inside vehicles).
Key.English:
Quick Menu?

The Quick Menu is where you can vote, open the quick-select interface and do several other things.

The Quick Menu can be accessed from the Action Menu, or the Communications Menu (inside vehicles).

Key.Original:
Why Vote?

By voting in the Quick Menu, you can control a number of things. You can start Operation, return to ARMEX or abort an active challenge. It is also possible to vote for a specific challenge to be started.
Key.English:
Why Vote?

By voting in the Quick Menu, you can control a number of things. You can start Operation, return to ARMEX or abort an active challenge. It is also possible to vote for a specific challenge to be started.

Key.English: What is ARMEX?
